title: HideYourKeys
author: HideYourKeys
created_time: January 03, 2025, 12:59:58 AMLast edit: January 03, 2025, 02:25:00 PM by HideYourKeys
content: Hi everyone!I spent some of my spare time during the holidays creating an 11-minute video where I try to summarize my personal perspective on Bitcoin (I mean to use it to orange-pill friends and family). And... I think it turned out relatively well (at least I think so, maybe it is not that good idk) . I'm excited to share it with the community here and would really appreciate any feedback, suggestions, or thoughts you might have!I'm always looking to improve, and it would mean a lot to hear what you think. Here it is:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KH35Ri9Bi34Wishing everyone a Happy New Year! May 2025 be filled with more Bitcoin

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: It's a great video, but there is a difference between bitcoin and blokchain... The first part about bitcoin you are talking about blockchain, and the fact that users can send money to other users is thanks to the blockchain, when you say that the transaction is direct from one user to another isn't true, there are a 3rd party involved, and those are the miners, without them no one would be able to send money to other users.But i really enjoy the animation and the voice is really clear, did you use any AI for the video?

comments.author: MAAManda
comments.body: All those explanations sound completely perfect, I don't think there are any more constructive suggestions for the video on the animation side. But what concerns me is the voice in the video, it sounds like a robotic voice. If it really is a robot/AI voice, I think it would be better if you made your own VO. Those are basic explanations about Bitcoin (BTC), will you then make further explanation videos about safe Bitcoin (BTC) storage and so on?

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: I think I agree with others that 11 minutes is a bit long for a video, but you did a great job from the parts I skimmed through. Perhaps if I didn’t already know all the information I would have been more willing to sit through the entire video as a learning experience. I do think shorter clips organized in a way that can be easily navigated would be a nice addition.

comments.author: Ziskinberg
comments.body: Nice work! It’s a great way to help educate the community. I see you currently have only 5 subscribers, but don’t worry, just keep doing your thing. Over time, those numbers will grow, and you might even gain some subscribers from the forum.   Lastly, I agree with @OgNasty: try making your videos shorter. Most viewers prefer quick, information-packed videos that are easy to digest.
